title: SRT6004 Engineering Design Project | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This module focuses on solving engineering problems in participants' workplaces through applied learning and research while also developing soft skills.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
This module focuses on solving engineering problems in participants' workplaces through applied learning and research while also developing soft skills.

Effective from AY2025/26 Trimester 2 (January 2026), the Postgraduate Certificate in Urban Railway Technology will be transiting to Graduate Certificate in Urban Railway Technology. For more details, please refer to the full notice
This module will explore techniques for solving engineering problems identified in participants’ workplaces and enable them to develop relevant analytical knowledge and skills.

With SIT’s focus on the importance of applied learning and research, participants will be tasked with working on a technical project that requires detailed industrial understanding and research application.

This module will also encourage critical thinking to address and solve complex engineering problems using various techniques, which supports the development of SIT-DNA in our graduates. During the execution of the design project, participants will aim to achieve the desired objectives effectively, including obtaining resources.

In the process, participants will also get the opportunity to develop soft skills such as goal setting, identifying the gap, setting up problem statements, and effective communication. This module is 1 of the 4 core modules under the Postgraduate Certificate in Urban Railway Technology.
Engineering professionals who have recently embarked on or are planning to start a career in the public transport industry, with specialisations in urban railway systems and technology
Participants who wish to obtain the Postgraduate Certificate in Urban Railway Technology
Demonstrate an understanding of engineering knowledge in the domain area of the project
Apply required technical skills in solving the workplace problem defined
Evaluate critically the needs and root causes of the engineering problems
Propose technical solutions to solve industrial problems with fundamental engineering concepts
Plan and execute a project independently with minimum supervision from project mentors
Communicate and justify solutions and ideas effectively through presentations
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Aaron Goh has a primary interest in the structure-property-function relationships of materials. He holds a BEng and a Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering from Imperial College London and his work experience includes being a Material Scientist at Unilever R&D. His achievements include the Research Fellowship from the Royal Commission of 1851 Exhibition as well as a Young Scientist Award from the American Association of Cereal Chemists International Rheology Division.
Associate Professor/ Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor/ Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Choo Jian Huei, Deputy Head of Design Factory at SIT, is a Mechanical Engineer by training, and a Tribologist at heart. Using design thinking, Dr. Choo has conducted training for many young and budding engineers to learn to create solutions from multi-disciplinary perspectives. Although he wears an engineer’s viewing glass, he strongly believes that design thinking can be applied to any discipline, bringing people of various backgrounds together to challenge current assumptions of how people interact with products or services, and to critically evaluate their ability to serve the needs of people.
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Desmond Chong is currently an Associate Professor with the Engineering Cluster of Singapore Institute of Technology. He received his BEng and MEng (by research) in Mechanical Engineering from Nanyang Technological University, and a PhD in Biomechanics from Imperial College London. His research interests are in the areas of orthopaedic and musculoskeletal biomechanics, finite element analysis and experimentation, medical devices design (joint implants and rehabilitation), and gait and human motion analyses. He is an active member of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME). He served as the Chair of the ASME Singapore Section in 2017/18 and 2011/12, and is currently the Chair for International Regions of the Member Development & Engagement Sector (ASME).
Assoc Professor/Head of Sustainability (Education and Research), Office of the Deputy President (Academic) & Provost, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assoc Professor/Head of Sustainability (Education and Research), Office of the Deputy President (Academic) & Provost, Singapore Institute of Technology

Associate Professor Ethan Chong specialises in sustainable development, engineering design, and artificial intelligence. As the Head of Sustainability (Education and Research) in the Office of the Provost, he develops SIT’s overall strategy for educational programmes in sustainability while extending and synergizing applied research activities related to sustainability. Dr. Chong envisions an industry driven by cutting-edge technologies and a continuous learning paradigm founded upon the requirements of the future economy. In SIT, he also supports the industry in developing solutions and manpower through training, consultation, and R&D.
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Gan Hiong Yap specialises in Reliability Engineering and LEAN Six Sigma. He has worked at the Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology, Matsushita Electronics Pte Ltd, Mitsubishi Chemical Infonics Pte Ltd prior to his career at SIT. He holds a Bachelor of Engineering (1st Hons) in Mechanical and Production Engineering and a PhD from Nanyang Technological University. He was a postdoctoral fellow at Research Laboratory of Electronics at Massachusetts Institute of Technology from 2010 - 2012.
Assistant Professor, Centre for Professional Communication, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor, Centre for Professional Communication, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Hwee Hoon is an experienced instructor in the use of language for communication. She possesses a doctorate in education from University of Leicester and a master in English Language teaching from University of Lancaster. Throughout her career, she has taught undergraduates and adult learners technical and professional communication, career skills, interpersonal communication, critical thinking, and presentation. Her message to learners has always been that language is a means through which we think and act, express ourselves and connect with others. She believes in empowering individuals with understanding to handle language and communication challenges they encounter at the workplace.
Asst Provost (Continuous Learning) /A/Prof /Deputy Dir, ARO, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Asst Provost (Continuous Learning) /A/Prof /Deputy Dir, ARO, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Mustafa is an Associate Professor in the Engineering Cluster with Singapore Institute of Technology who specializes in Robotics and Lean Manufacturing. He is also the Deputy Director of SIT’s Applied Research Office, which provides overall strategic research direction as well as overseeing research governance and grant administration. He was previously a Research Scientist at the Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology A*STAR, leading a team in industrial robotics initiatives for productivity enhancement in the local manufacturing sector. 

In addition to actively teaching and developing robotics curriculum for both undergraduate and adult learners, he provides consultancy services and actively leads applied research projects to develop robotic automation solutions in various industry sectors such as manufacturing and built environment. He holds a Bachelors in Engineering (Mechanical & Production Engineering with Mechatronics Specialization) and Doctor of Philosophy (Robotics) from the Nanyang Technological University, Singapore.
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the module; and
Undertake and pass credit bearing assessment (worth 6 credits) during the module, which can be stacked towards the Postgraduate Certificate in Urban Railway Technology
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$5,886.00
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.
Subscribe to our mailing list to learn about the latest dates as soon as they become available.

The Postgraduate Certificate in Urban Railway Technology is designed to equip engineering professionals with specialised technical and practical skills to further provide a safe, efficient, and reliable mass rapid transit system in Singapore.

With the maritime industry turning to lower carbon fuels and energy-efficient technologies to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, the Masterclass in Maritime Decarbonisation offered by SIT steers knowledge acquisition in this direction.

Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical expertise in engineering design, 3D modelling and analysis and prototype development. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Infrastructure and Systems Engineering.
BEng (Hons) in Infrastructure & Systems Engineering (via the CSM Pathway)
Systems Engineering, Transport Engineering, Competency-based Education
Learn how various systems work together in a full electric plug-in ship, contributing to the achievement of the net-zero emissions target by 2050.

This course is a collaboration with SNAMES and SSA. Gain insights into the latest shipping decarbonisation and energy-efficient technologies, energy storage systems, and be ready for alternative green fuels.
Electric Vehicles and Charging Infrastructure for Decarbonisation of Land Transportation
Learn about sustainable transportation systems and technologies, while delving into electric vehicles and their associated infrastructure.
Transport Engineering, Sustainability, Energy Efficiency, Executive Education
SRT6001 Singapore Land Transport Landscape and Fundamentals of Rail Engineering
This examination covers topics in Career Onboarding for Railway Engineering and Fundamentals of Rail Engineering Systems.
Postgraduate Certificate in Urban Railway Technology
MEC6012 Systems Engineering for Urban Railway Systems
This module covers the fundamental principles and concepts of systems engineering, and their application to railway systems.
Postgraduate Certificate in Urban Railway Technology

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
